text: 3G - WATER RIGHTS ADJUDICATION
label: HH1

text: Adjudication of water rights through the state courts should be completed to fully define
label: HH1

text: and quantify all state, tribal and federal water rights.
label: HH1

text: Discussion:
label: HH1

text: The purpose of a general stream adjudication is to provide certainty and predictability in the
label: TITLE

text: administration and distribution of water diverting from hydraulically connected water sources.  The
label: BODY

text: need for a general adjudication of water rights in the Snake River Basin became apparent as the
label: BODY

text: spring flows in the Thousand Springs reach began to decline and disputes arose over the availability
label: BODY

text: of water supplies on the Snake River Plain.  As part of the 1984 Swan Falls Agreement, the State
label: BODY

text: agreed to commence the Snake River Basin Adjudication, the largest legal proceeding in the history
label: BODY

text: of the state.  The SRBA is the cornerstone for the long-term management of the Snake River Basin
label: BODY

text: within Idaho. At the conclusion of the SRBA, the state will have a listing of all water rights within the
label: BODY

text: basin, which is the predicate for establishing water districts to administer all water rights in
label: BODY

text: accordance with the prior appropriation doctrine, as established by law.
label: BODY

text: Pursuant to Idaho Code § 42-1734(3), the IWRB is authorized to represent the state, when requested
label: BODY

text: to do so by the Governor, in proceedings, negotiations, and hearings involving the federal
label: BODY

text: government. In the SRBA, the IWRB coordinated state participation in the negotiation of federal
label: BODY

text: reserved water rights, including tribal claims. The IWRB successfully negotiated agreements
label: BODY

text: resolving federal reserved right claims including those filed by the Shoshone-Bannock, Nez Perce,
label: BODY

text: and Shoshone-Paiute tribes as well as the claims of numerous federal agencies.  The final settlement
label: BODY

text: of the Nez Perce Tribe’s claims reflected the tribe’s and the state’s shared interest in addressing
label: BODY

text: environmental concerns and addressed the conflicting demands for consumptive and nonconsumptive
label: BODY

text: uses.  Consistent with state law, Tthe IWRB should serve as the lead agency for coordinating state
label: BODY

text: participation in all general stream adjudications.
label: BODY

text: On November 12, 2008, the district court ordered the commencement of an adjudication in the Coeur
label: BODY

text: d’Alene Spokane River water system.  Like the SRBA, the determination of all existing water rights
label: BODY

text: from the water basins in Northern Idaho will provide the basis for administration of water rights in
label: BODY

text: accordance with the prior appropriation doctrine, as established by law.
label: BODY
